alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Grainger; Hancock; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 9:52AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM EST THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Claiborne, Grainger, Hancock and Union. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Lee and Wise. * WHEN...From 7 PM EST this evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - One to three inches of rain are expected, with locally higher amounts possible with any training thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
